AU: Alpay, D; Colombo, F; Lewkowicz, I; Sabadini, I
AF: Alpay, Daniel; Colombo, Fabrizio; Lewkowicz, Izchak; Sabadini, Irene
TI: Realizations of Slice Hyperholomorphic Generalized Contractive and Positive Functions
DE: Schur functions; realization; reproducing kernels; slice hyperholomorphic functions; Hardy spaces; S-resolvent operators
AB: We introduce generalized Schur functions and generalized positive functions in the setting of slice hyperholomorphic functions and study their realizations in terms of associated reproducing kernel Pontryagin spaces. To this end, we also prove some results in quaternionic functional analysis like an invariant subspace theorem for contractions in a Pontryagin space. We also consider slice hyperholomorphic functions on the half space of quaternions with positive real parts and we study the Hardy space H (2) and Blaschke products in this framework.
C1: [Alpay, Daniel] Ben Gurion Univ Negev, Dept Math, IL-84105 Beer Sheva, Israel; [Colombo, Fabrizio; Sabadini, Irene] Politecnico Milano, Dipartimento Matemat, I-20133 Milan, Italy; [Lewkowicz, Izchak] Ben Gurion Univ Negev, Dept Elect Engn, IL-84105 Beer Sheva, Israel
RP: Alpay, D (reprint author), Ben Gurion Univ Negev, Dept Math, IL-84105 Beer Sheva, Israel.
FU: Earl Katz family; Binational Science Foundation [2010117]; Center for Advanced Studies of the Mathematical Department of the Ben-Gurion University of the Negev

Sabadini acknowledge the Center for Advanced Studies of the Mathematical Department of the Ben-Gurion University of the Negev for the support and the kind hospitality during the period in which part of this paper has been written.

TI: On a Nonlinear Nonlocal Hyperbolic System Modeling Suspension Bridges
ID: LARGE TORSIONAL OSCILLATIONS; TACOMA NARROWS BRIDGE; FLEXIBLE BRIDGES; WIND
AB: We suggest a new model for the dynamics of a suspension bridge through a system of nonlinear nonlocal hyperbolic differential equations. The equations are of second and fourth order in space and describe the behavior of the main components of the bridge: the deck, the sustaining cables and the connecting hangers. We compute all the energies involved and we derive the equations from variational principles. We then prove existence and uniqueness of a weak solution for the resulting problem.
C1: [Arioli, Gianni] Politecn Milan, MOX Modellist & Calcolo Sci, Dipartimento Matemat, I-20133 Milan, Italy; [Gazzola, Filippo] Politecn Milan, Dipartimento Matemat, I-20133 Milan, Italy
RP: Arioli, G (reprint author), Politecn Milan, MOX Modellist & Calcolo Sci, Dipartimento Matemat, Piazza Leonardo da Vinci 32, I-20133 Milan, Italy.

TI: The Role of Surface Diffusion in Dynamic Boundary Conditions: Where Do We Stand?
DE: Dynamic; dynamical; global attractor; Weyl law; Wentzell Laplacian; elliptic; parabolic; reaction-diffusion
ID: PARABOLIC EQUATIONS; ELLIPTIC-SYSTEMS; LAPLACE EQUATION; GLOBAL ATTRACTOR
AB: In this study, we investigate reaction-diffusion and elliptic-like equations with two classes of dynamic boundary conditions, of reactive and reactive-diffusive type. We provide sharp upper and lower bounds on the dimension of the global attractor in all these cases. In particular, we emphasize how surface diffusion can act as a damping force in reducing the degree of complexity in these systems. We obtain a new Weyl asymptotic law for eigenvalue sequences associated with a family of perturbed Wentzell operators which is of independent interest.
C1: Florida Int Univ, Dept Math, Miami, FL 33199 USA
RP: Gal, CG (reprint author), Florida Int Univ, Dept Math, DM 435B, Miami, FL 33199 USA.

AU: Carriero, M; Leaci, A; Tomarelli, F
AF: Carriero, Michele; Leaci, Antonio; Tomarelli, Franco
TI: A Survey on the Blake-Zisserman Functional
DE: Calculus of variations; image segmentation; inpainting; free discontinuity; Almansi decomposition; crack-tip
ID: IMAGE SEGMENTATION; APPROXIMATION; EXISTENCE; JUMPS; MINIMIZER; MODEL
AB: The aim of this work is to provide a concise survey of results about the Blake-Zisserman functional for image segmentation and inpainting. Moreover a refinement of the Almansi decomposition is shown for biharmonic functions in 2-dimensional open disks with crack-tip at the origin.
C1: [Carriero, Michele; Leaci, Antonio] Univ Salento, Dipartimento Matemat & Fis Ennio De Giorgi, I-73100 Lecce, Italy; [Tomarelli, Franco] Politecn Milan, Dipartimento Matemat, I-20133 Milan, Italy
RP: Carriero, M (reprint author), Univ Salento, Dipartimento Matemat & Fis Ennio De Giorgi, I-73100 Lecce, Italy.
FX: This work is supported by PRIN 2010-2011 M.I.U.R (Progetto "Calculus of Variations").

TI: The Saint-Venant Inequality for the Laplace Operator with Robin Boundary Conditions
DE: Faber-Krahn inequality; Saint-Venant inequality; shape optimization; Robin-Laplacian
ID: CONCENTRATION-COMPACTNESS PRINCIPLE; FABER-KRAHN INEQUALITY; ARBITRARY DOMAINS; CALCULUS
AB: This survey paper is focused on the Saint-Venant inequality for the Laplace operator with Robin boundary conditions. In a larger context, we make the point on the recent advances concerning isoperimetric inequalities of Faber-Krahn type for elastically supported membranes and describe the main ideas of their proofs in both contexts of rearrangement and free discontinuity techniques.
C1: [Bucur, Dorin] Univ Savoie Mont Blanc, CNRS UMR 5127, Math Lab, F-73376 Le Bourget Du Lac, France; [Giacomini, Alessandro] Univ Brescia, DICATAM, Sez Matemat, I-25133 Brescia, Italy
RP: Bucur, D (reprint author), Univ Savoie Mont Blanc, CNRS UMR 5127, Math Lab, Campus Sci, F-73376 Le Bourget Du Lac, France.
FX: The first author was supported by the ANR Optiform research programme, ANR-12-BS01-0007. This paper surveys the talk given by the first author to the Seminario Mathematic Fisico, Milano in November 2014 and reports on to the joint work of the authors concerning shape optimization problems with Robin conditions on the free boundary.

TI: Classifications of Canal Surfaces with L-1-Pointwise 1-Type Gauss Map
DE: Canal surface; Gauss map; L-1-pointwise 1-type; Cheng-Yau operator
AB: In this paper, we study canal surfaces in the Euclidean 3-space in terms of their Gauss map. We obtain a complete classification of such surfaces whose Gauss map G satisfies for a non-zero smooth function f and a constant vector C, where denotes the Cheng-Yau operator.
C1: [Qian, Jinhua] Northeastern Univ, Dept Math, Shenyang 110004, Peoples R China; [Kim, Young Ho] Kyungpook Natl Univ, Dept Math, Taegu 702701, South Korea

AU: Duzgun, FG; Fornaro, S; Vespri, V
AF: Duezguen, Fatma Gamze; Fornaro, Simona; Vespri, Vincenzo
TI: Interior Harnack Estimates: The State-of-the-Art for Quasilinear Singular Parabolic Equations
DE: Degenerate and Singular Parabolic Equations; Pointwise Estimates; Harnack estimates; Weak solutions
ID: ELLIPTIC DIFFERENTIAL EQUATIONS; NONNEGATIVE SOLUTIONS; WEAK SOLUTIONS; HOLDER CONTINUITY; LOCAL BEHAVIOR; POROUS-MEDIUM; INEQUALITY; DEGENERATE; PROOF; THEOREM
AB: In this paper we give some historical information about elliptic and parabolic Harnack inequalities. Then we state the main results known for Harnack inequalities of solutions to quasilinear degenerate parabolic equations. Lastly we focus our attention on Harnack inequalities of solutions to quasilinear singular parabolic equations where the theory did important steps forward in the last few years but still there are some points to be fully understood.

TI: A Class of Quasilinear Dirichlet Problems with Unbounded Coefficients and Singular Quadratic Lower Order Terms

ID: NONLINEAR ELLIPTIC-EQUATIONS; EXISTENCE; GRADIENT; GROWTH; NONEXISTENCE
AB: We study existence and regularity of positive solutions of problems like {-div([a(x) + u(q)]del u) + b(x)1/u(theta) vertical bar del u vertical bar(2) = f in Omega, u > 0 in Omega, u = 0 on partial derivative Omega, depending on the values of q > 0, 0 < theta < 1, and on the summability of the datum f >= 0 in Lebesgue spaces.

AU: Aquino, CP; de Lima, HF; dos Santos, FR; Velasquez, MAL
AF: Aquino, Cicero P.; de Lima, Henrique F.; dos Santos, Fabio R.; Velasquez, Marco Antonio L.
TI: Characterizations of Spacelike Hyperplanes in the Steady State Space via Generalized Maximum Principles
DE: Steady state space; complete spacelike hypersurfaces; spacelike hyper-planes; mean curvature; Gauss map
ID: CONSTANT MEAN-CURVATURE; SITTER SPACE; HYPERSURFACES; GRAPHS
AB: We deal with complete spacelike hypersurfaces immersed in the half of the de Sitter space, which models the so-called steady state space. In this setting, under some appropriated constraints on the geometry of such a spacelike hypersurface, we apply suitable generalized maximum principles in order to guarantee that it must be isometric to the Euclidean space.

AU: Ciaurri, O; Roncal, L; Stinga, PR
AF: Ciaurri, Oscar; Roncal, Luz; Stinga, Pablo Raul
TI: Riesz Transforms on Compact Riemannian Symmetric Spaces of Rank One
DE: Analysis on compact Riemannian symmetric spaces of rank 1; Laplace-Beltrami operator; Riesz transform; mixed norm spaces; Rubio de Francia extrapolation theorem; Jacobi expansions
AB: In this paper we prove mixed norm estimates for Riesz transforms related to Laplace-Beltrami operators on compact Riemannian symmetric spaces of rank one. These operators are closely related to the Riesz transforms for Jacobi polynomials expansions. The key point is to obtain sharp estimates for the kernel of the Jacobi-Riesz transforms with uniform control on the parameters, together with an adaptation of Rubio de Francia's extrapolation theorem. The latter results are of independent interest.
C1: [Ciaurri, Oscar; Roncal, Luz] Univ La Rioja, Dept Matemat & Computac, Logrono 26004, Spain; [Stinga, Pablo Raul] Univ Texas Austin, Dept Math, Austin, TX 78712 USA

TI: W (1,1)(Omega) Solutions of Nonlinear Problems with Nonhomogeneous Neumann Boundary Conditions
DE: Nonlinear problems; Neumann boundary condition; distributional solutions
AB: In this paper we study the existence of W (1,1)(Omega) distributional solutions of the nonlinear problems with Neumann boundary condition. The simplest model is {-Delta(p)u + vertical bar u vertical bar(s-1) u-0, in Omega; vertical bar del u vertical bar(p-2)del u . eta = psi, on partial derivative Omega; where Omega is a bounded domain in R-N with smooth boundary partial derivative Omega, 1 < p < N, s > 0, eta is the unit outward normal on partial derivative Omega and psi is an element of L-m(partial derivative Omega), m > 1.
C1: [Boccardo, Lucio] Univ Roma La Sapienza, Dipartimento Matemat, I-00185 Rome, Italy; [Moreno-Merida, Lourdes] Univ Granada, Dept Anal Matemat, E-18071 Granada, Spain

TI: The Descending Flow Method and Existence of Solutions for a Class of Elliptic Equations
DE: Gradient flow; general Palais-Smale condition; invariant sets; semilinear elliptic problem; existence of multiple solutions
ID: BOUNDARY-VALUE-PROBLEMS; MULTIPLE SOLUTIONS THEOREMS; SIGN-CHANGING SOLUTIONS; JUMPING NONLINEARITIES; FUCIK SPECTRUM; INVARIANT-SETS; P-LAPLACIAN; INFINITY; ZERO
AB: We minimize the energy functional on invariant sets by the minus gradient flow. We characterize invariant sets by this flow and we identify disjoint invariant sets in which the functional is bounded from below, leading us to get three distinct solutions: a positive, a negative and a sign-changing one.
C1: [Montenegro, Marcelo] Univ Estadual Campinas, Dept Matemat, IMECC, BR-13083859 Campinas, SP, Brazil; [Presoto, Adilson E.] Univ Fed Sao Carlos, Dept Matemat, BR-13565905 Sao Carlos, SP, Brazil
RP: Montenegro, M (reprint author), Univ Estadual Campinas, Dept Matemat, IMECC, Rua Sergio Buarque de Holanda 651, BR-13083859 Campinas, SP, Brazil.

TI: Myers and Hawking Theorems: Geometry for the Limits of the Universe
DE: Focal points; expanding hypersurface; positive Ricci curvature; singularity theorems; separating and Cauchy hypersurfaces; timelike convergence
AB: It is known that the celebrated theorem by Hawking which assures the existence of a Big-Bang under physically motivated hypotheses, uses geometric ideas inspired in classical Myers theorem. Our aim here is to go a step further: first, a result which can be interpreted as the exact analogy in pure Riemannian geometry to Hawking theorem will be proven and, then, the isomorphic role of the hypotheses in both theorems will be analyzed. This will provide some interesting links between Riemannian and Lorentzian geometries, as well as an introduction to the latter. The reader interested only in Riemannian Geometry can regard this new result as a simple application of Myers theorem combined with the properties of focal points. However, readers with broader perspectives will learn that when a geometer thinks in our space as a complete Riemannian manifold, a relativist may think in our spacetime as predictable, or that suitable bounds on the Ricci tensor will force geodesics either to converge in the space or to join in the time. Moreover, the limitation of the distance from any point to a hypersurface in a Riemannian manifold, may turn out into a catastrophic relativistic limit for the duration of our physical Universe.
C1: [Morales Alvarez, Pablo; Sanchez, Miguel] Univ Granada, Dept Geometria & Topol, Fac Ciencias, E-18071 Granada, Spain
RP: Alvarez, PM (reprint author), Univ Granada, Dept Geometria & Topol, Fac Ciencias, Campus Fuentenueva S-N, E-18071 Granada, Spain.
FU: Beca de Iniciacion a la Investigacion, plan propio de (Vicerrectorado de Politica Cientifica e Investigacion, Univ. Granada); Spanish MINECO and FEDER funds [MTM2013-47828-C2-1-P]

AU: Lopez, MC; Masque, JM; Maria, ER
AF: Castrillon Lopez, M.; Munoz Masque, J.; Rosado Maria, E.
TI: Killing Vector Fields of Generic Semi-Riemannian Metrics
DE: Isometry group; jet bundle; Killing vector field; pseudo-Riemannian metric; Ricci invariant
AB: Let M be a smooth oriented connected n-dimensional manifold and let be the space of pseudo-Riemannian metrics on M of a given signature . A system of n metric invariants is attached to each metric in , called the Ricci invariants, and by using the geometric properties of such invariants, the following result is proved: The subset of metrics with no Killing vector fields other than the trivial one is open and dense with respect to the strong topology.

AU: de Godoi, JDB; Miyagaki, OH; Rodrigues, RS
AF: de Godoi, J. D. B.; Miyagaki, O. H.; Rodrigues, R. S.
TI: Steklov-Neumann Eigenproblens: A Spectral Characterization of the Sobolev Trace Spaces
DE: Steklov-Neumann eigenvalue; variational methods; elliptic system
ID: BOUNDARY-VALUE-PROBLEMS; ISOPERIMETRIC INEQUALITY; ELLIPTIC-EQUATIONS; MULTIPLE SOLUTIONS; EIGENVALUE
AB: We will study two classes of the eigenvalues problems for elliptic systems: one of them for the Steklov and another one for Neumann. In both problems we guarantee the existence of an increasing unbounded sequence of eigenvalues. The results were basically justified through of the variational arguments.

TI: Existence of Multi-bump Solutions for a Class of Quasilinear Schrodinger Equations in Involving Critical Growth
DE: Quasilinear Schrodinger equation; critical growth; multi-bump solutions; variational methods
ID: SEMILINEAR ELLIPTIC PROBLEMS; POSITIVE SOLUTIONS; SEMICLASSICAL STATES; SOLITON-SOLUTIONS; CRITICAL FREQUENCY; STANDING WAVES; BOUND-STATES; MULTIPLICITY
AB: In this paper we prove the existence of multi-bump solutions for a class of quasilinear Schrodinger equations of the form in the whole space, where h is a continuous function, are continuous functions. We assume that V(x) is nonnegative and has a potential well consisting of k components such that the interior of Omega (i) is not empty and is smooth. By using a change of variables, the quasilinear equations are reduced to a semilinear one, whose associated functionals are well defined in the usual Sobolev space and satisfy the geometric conditions of the mountain pass theorem for suitable assumptions. We show that for any given non-empty subset. , a bump solution is trapped in a neighborhood of for large enough.

TI: The Discrete and Classical Dirichlet Problem: Part II
DE: Dirichlet Problem; harmonic functions; random walks; finite differences; Quasidiscs
AB: For any domain Omega subset of R-p, we denote by u the solution of the Dirichlet Problem with data f at the boundary. Similarly, we denote by u(d) the solution that satisfies the average property on a discrete grid and the same boundary data. We give optimal estimates for the difference parallel to u - u(d)parallel to(infinity).
